item.title: The case for burning counterterrorism operations
item.description: In January 2021, a debate had coursed through the infosec community regarding Google’s TAG and P0 decision to publish a report on what they suspected could be a western antiterrorism operation. While there were dissenting voices back then, it seemed like there was a degree of industry consensus that Google’s decision was the correct one. Fast forward to June 24, 2024: Michael Coppola releases a blog post firmly in favor of not disclosing such cyberattacks, which I encourage reading. This is as good an occasion as any to lay down my thoughts on the subject.

item.title: Using aerc-mail with Outlook
item.description: I am a college student in America where there are unfortunately only two email servers that universities use: Google Workplace Gmail and Microsoft Office 365. Up until this point I’ve used the Office suite without complaints. However, being an average terminal enjoyer, I recently started using a terminal based email client personal email.
